Random Walk View source

The random walk component creates a series of values based on the Geometric Brownian Motion stochastic process. The random financial component uses it to create random open-high-low-close (OHLC) price data.

var walk = fc.data.random.walk()
  .period(2)   // Projection period, by default = 1
  .steps(30)   // Number of steps to take, by default = 20
  .mu(0.3)     // Drift component, by default = 0.1
  .sigma(0.2); // Volatility, by default = 0.1

// generate some data!
var data = walk(100); // The series starts at 100

d3.select('#walk')
  .text(JSON.stringify(data, null, 2));

The data generated is returned as a simple numeric array.
